p: High-throughput sequencing revealed multiple fungal families as indicative for invasion. In the previous section we hypothesized that this difference in response could have been caused by a difference in food preference between the lineages. Interestingly, Cladosporium was identified as a moderate feeding source for Aphelenchoidides sp [ 49], which is in line with our observations. Unfortunately, little is known about food preferences of fungivorous nematode taxa. The indicator families observed in this research could be an interesting starting point for research targeting nematode feeding preferences. The fungal families boosted by S. gigantea in a riparian habitat could be especially informative as Aphelenchidae and Aphelenchoididae showed a remarkable increase in these soils.
